page.title: 04THE BRIDGE
page.content: The bridge which spans the River Nene at Sutton Bridge dates back to 1897.This present bridge is the third bridge to be built. The bridge was built to take both road and rail traffic. The railways stopped in 1964 and so the bridge now carries only road traffic.The traffic passing over the bridge is estimated at more than three thousand an hour, trvalling to the coast of Norfolk and the South. The bridge is vitally important to drivers coming from the North wishing to visit the South East. The bridge is a swing bridge that opens on average once a day to allow ships to pass to the port of Wisbech.
